column2: POWLAX Printable Playbooks
column3:
Access detailed plays, drills, and step-by-step formations to help you confidently lead your team—just print and go!
  • Pairs with POWLAX Videos for maximum understanding.
  • Instant Download: Get your entire season’s blueprint in minutes.
  • Clear Diagrams & Notes: Eliminate confusion and communicate like a pro.
  • Boost Team IQ: Clear visuals help players learn faster.
  • Always Accessible: Keep physical copies on hand anytime you need a refresher.

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

  • Username: {$username}
  • Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Printable Playbooks. To download the PDF’s, log in to POWLAX.com and use the “Coaches Corner” Menu in the FOOTER of the site to navigate to a strategy or drill video page of the PDF you’d like to download. Click the red PDF button under the video and your download will start.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

column2: POWLAX Gold Monthly Membership
column3:
POWLAX Gold Membership
  • 450+ Done-for-You Diagrams: Tap into pre-built plays or create your own.
  • Printable & Digital Options: Print for the sideline or view on your phone.
  • Video Integration: Each diagram pairs with POWLAX videos for quick, clear learning.
  • Instant Access: Download and go; perfect for on-the-spot coaching adjustments.
  • Boost Team IQ: Step-by-step formations help players learn faster and stay unified.

column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:43:"** Thanks for becoming a POWLAX Gold Member";s:4:"body";s:4470:"

Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}

Please make sure to read through this email completely to get the most out of your experience with POWLAX.

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

Username: {$username}

Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s.  To download the PDF’s, log in and use the menu on POWLAX.com to navigate to a strategy or drill video click the red pdf button under the video to download the Playbook PDF that corresponds to the video.

Activating The POWLAX Digital Playbook on Lacrosse Lab. 

As a part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com.  I will be adding you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually.  Please allow up to 24 hours to receive the invite email.  Make sure to check your junk folder.  If you do not receive the email from lacrosse lab, please email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Lacrosse lab is best when using their iOS App.  Download it from the Apple App Store.

Utilizing Lacrosse Labs Practice Planning and Event Notifications

If you are planning to utilize the email notifications from lacrosse lab service, make sure to find the lacrosse lab email invite to join.  That way your email server will put their emails into your inbox and not your junk folder.

Sharing the POWLAX Digital Playbook Plays with Your Team

As a part of {$product_name} you have the ability to share the plays and drills from the POWLAX Digital Playbook with your players.  In order to do that, you must have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account.  If you do not have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account, you can get more information here: https://labradorsports.com/lacrosse-pricing/

Once you have a team account and access to the POWLAX Gold Account, you will be able to share the plays from the POWLAX Gold Account to your team account by clicking on the plays or folders in the POWLAX Gold Playbook, clicking share, and sharing them to your team.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

";}}

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account

You can add your players/coaches by clicking the Sub Accounts Button in the right column on this page: https://powlax.com/account/?action=subscriptions

column2: POWLAX Digital Playbook: Individual Edition
column3:
Digital Lacrosse Playbooks at Your Fingertips

Stop building from scratch. Our done-for-you lacrosse plays and drills keep you winning—straight from any device.

  • 450+ Digital Diagrams
  • Works with POWLAX videos for smooth understanding
  • No Heavy Binders: Everything is already on your phone.
  • View Anytime: Check your plays whenever you want.
  • Mix or Match: Use prebuilt POWLAX plays or build your own from scratch.
column9: Screen Shot 2021-01-26 at 2.03.30 PM|POWLAX Digital Playbook - Program Membership
column36: POWLAX Digital Playbook
column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:51:"**Thanks for Purchasing the POWLAX Digital Playbook";s:4:"body";s:2070:"

Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}!

Please read through this email completely to get the most out of your experience with POWLAX.

1. Logging In

You can log in here: {$login_page}
Use the following credentials:

  • Username: {$username}
  • Password: The password you created during registration.

2. Activating the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab

As part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com. I will add you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually within 24 hours. Once added, you will receive an invite email from LacrosseLab—please check your spam or junk folder if you don’t see it in your inbox.

If you still don’t receive the invite, email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Tip: For the best experience, download the LacrosseLab iOS app from the Apple App Store.

3. Utilizing LacrosseLab’s Practice Planning and Event Notifications

LacrosseLab includes tools for practice planning and event notifications. Once you receive the invitation email from LacrosseLab:

  1. Open the email and follow the instructions to join.
  2. Add LacrosseLab to your email contacts so future notifications land in your inbox instead of your junk folder.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let’s continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love.

- Patrick Chapla

";}}

column2: Create an Account
column36: Create an Account
column48:
You’re officially in! Every free POWLAX resource is now unlocked and waiting for you. Start by choosing the page built for your role:

  • Coaches: Hundreds of free strategy videos, drills, & more.

  • Players: Up your Lax IQ & improve your skills.

  • Parents: Lacrosse 101 guides & Community

  • Club Directors: Club OS systems for every team

What happens next?

  • Log In - using your username and password to jump straight into your new account.

  • View / Update Your Profile: Hover over your User Icon (Top Right) → Click My Profile.

  • Explore the Community: Open Community in the main menu to browse discussion groups, post questions, and swap ideas with other POWLAX members.

  • Manage Your Subscriptions: From your profile, choose Membership & Subscriptions to review, upgrade, or cancel any plan—no hidden hoops.

To smarter reps and bigger smiles,

Patrick Chapla
Founder, POWLAX
column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:51:"Welcome to POWLAX — Pick Your Path & Get After It";s:4:"body";s:2882:"

Hi {$user_first_name},

You’re officially in! Every free POWLAX resource is now unlocked and waiting for you. Start by choosing the page built for your role:

  • Coaches: Hundreds of free strategy videos, drills, & more.

  • Players: Up your Lax IQ & improve your skills.

  • Parents: Lacrosse 101 guides & Community

  • Club Directors: Club OS systems for every team

What happens next?

  • Log In - using your username and password to jump straight into your new account.

  • View / Update Your Profile: Hover over your name → https://powlax.com/members/{$username}/profile/

  • Explore the Community: Open Community in the main menu to browse discussion groups, post questions, and swap ideas with other POWLAX members.

  • Manage Your Subscriptions: From your profile, choose Membership & Subscriptions to review, upgrade, or cancel any plan—no hidden hoops → https://powlax.com/members/{$username}/mp-membership/mp-subscriptions/

To smarter reps and bigger smiles,

Patrick Chapla
Founder, POWLAX

";}}

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Cuse Motion Offense! In this comprehensive course, you will be taken step by step through the key principles and tactics of this popular offensive system. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through every aspect of the Cuse Motion Offense, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

Virginia’s 2-2-2 from X played an extensive role in their 2019 National Championship run. Virginia used it to score: the game-winning goal in overtime vs Syracuse in the regular season, the game-winning goal in overtime vs Maryland in the quarterfinals, the game-tying and game-winning goals vs Duke in the Semi-Finals, and 5 of 13 goals in the National Championship vs Yale.

The keys to Virginia’s 2-2-2 from X are:

Simplicity - It’s simple enough to allow players to alternate between positions.

Easy Reads - Defensive decisions create a cascade of reads that are easy to see and teach.

Spacing - The spacing makes defensive decisions difficult and allows players to freelance easily if the prescribed looks aren’t there.

This Master Class includes the Virginia 2-2-2 From X POWLAX Playbook PDF.

Upon completing the quiz with an 80% score, you will receive a POWLAX Certificate of Completion.

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Ohio State Pairs Offense! This course will take you through the offensive system that Ohio State used to crush Denver in 2017 on their way to a National Championship appearance. Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 2 Man Game! This comprehensive course will teach you about the various tactics and strategies used by two players with the goal of getting one of them open and in on goal. The 2 Man Game has become a staple of collegiate lacrosse, with every team that made the NCAA Tournament in 2019 using it as a primary attacking principle within their offense. In this course, you will learn about the perfect Pick and a range of other options that players have as they move into and out of the traditional "Pick and Roll" scenario. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through the key principles and tactics of the 2 Man Game, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the "Executing and Defending 2 Man Games Playbook PDF."

This Master Class includes many lessons with their own individual quizzes.

column2: Twist Man Up Play Master Class
column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Twist Man Up Play! This simple yet efficient play can be used by teams of all levels, from 6th grade to varsity. The Twist Man Up Play is designed to allow players to read the play rather than look for specific looks, making it a foundational element of any team's game plan. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through the key principles and tactics of the Twist Man Up Play, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's man-up offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Twist Man Up Play POWLAX Playbook PDF.

Earn the Twist Man Up Play Certificate of Completion by passing the quiz with a score of 80% or higher.

column2: Defending 2 Man Games Master Class
column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on defending 2 Man Games! In this comprehensive course, you will learn strategies to defend against a variety of 2 Man Games including Picks, Shallow Cuts, Mirrors, Fades, Give and Goes, and Overlaps. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through the key principles and tactics of 2 Man Game defense, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's defense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on off-ball decision-making in 2 Man Games! In this course, you will learn about the choices and options available to off-ball players in various 2 Man Games situations. Patrick will guide you through the key principles and tactics of off-ball decision-making, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach or player, this course will help you take your team's offensive decision-making within 2 Man Games to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the “Executing and Defending 2 Man Games” PDF!

Led by, 2019 Tewaaraton Award Finalist and record-setting distributor Grant Ament (1) and sniper Mac O’Keefe (3), Penn State scored 17.94 goals per game and had the #1 offense in 2019. Although the performance of Ament and O’Keefe drew the headlines, neither would have achieved nearly as much without the exceptional play of Dylan Foulds (14), Nick Spillane (13), Jack Kelly (25), TJ Malone (7), and a few others. Anytime the defense gave Ament or O’Keefe too much room they would get burned. When the defense adjusted to help cover Ament or O’Keefe the others would capitalize. The six players were like piranhas, combining to be nearly unstoppable.

This Master Class will walk you through the 3 phases of the Penn State Offense: The 3 High Pairs Offense, 1-4-1 Wing Pairs Offense, and the Picks Behind Offense.

This Master Class includes the Penn State Offense Playbook PDF

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense! This course will teach you the first portion of Penn State's 2019 offense, which utilizes pairs on the wings, an off-ball player up top, and hang-up games at X. Patrick will guide you through the key principles and tactics of the 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Penn State 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense Playbook PDF.

Complete the 1-4-1- Wing Pairs Offense quiz with a score of 80% or more and receive the POWLAX 1-4-1 Wing Pairs Offense Certificate of Completion!

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 21-12 offensive concept! This innovative course will teach you a revolutionary approach to offense that combines four traditional sets – 2-2-2, 2-3-1, 1-3-2, and Open – into a single, easy-to-understand system. The 21-12 concept is perfect for coaches looking to quickly train and modify their players' skills using small-sided 3 Man games and motions. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide you with the knowledge and tools you need to take your team's offensive game to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

  • 450+ Done-for-You Diagrams: Tap into pre-built plays or create your own.

column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:40:"** Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}";s:4:"body";s:4470:"

Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}

Please make sure to read through this email completely to get the most out of your experience with POWLAX.

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

Username: {$username}

Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s.  To download the PDF’s, log in and use the menu on POWLAX.com to navigate to a strategy or drill video click the red pdf button under the video to download the Playbook PDF that corresponds to the video.

Activating The POWLAX Digital Playbook on Lacrosse Lab. 

As a part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com.  I will be adding you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually.  Please allow up to 24 hours to receive the invite email.  Make sure to check your junk folder.  If you do not receive the email from lacrosse lab, please email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Lacrosse lab is best when using their iOS App.  Download it from the Apple App Store.

Utilizing Lacrosse Labs Practice Planning and Event Notifications

If you are planning to utilize the email notifications from lacrosse lab service, make sure to find the lacrosse lab email invite to join.  That way your email server will put their emails into your inbox and not your junk folder.

Sharing the POWLAX Digital Playbook Plays with Your Team

As a part of {$product_name} you have the ability to share the plays and drills from the POWLAX Digital Playbook with your players.  In order to do that, you must have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account.  If you do not have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account, you can get more information here: https://labradorsports.com/lacrosse-pricing/

Once you have a team account and access to the POWLAX Gold Account, you will be able to share the plays from the POWLAX Gold Account to your team account by clicking on the plays or folders in the POWLAX Gold Playbook, clicking share, and sharing them to your team.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

";}}

  Welcome to our lacrosse master class on mastering faceoffs! Faceoffs can be a crucial factor in winning or losing a game, so it's important to have a solid strategy in place. In this course, we will teach you a simple but effective approach to faceoffs that will give your faceoff unit the best chance of success at the X. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse player or coach, this course will provide you with the strategy you need to dominate the faceoff X. Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Near Man Defense! This course will cover a man-to-man defense strategy that combines elements from both crease and adjacent slide defenses. The Near Man Defense is designed to address and eliminate some of the challenges that can arise when using either of these defenses individually. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse player or coach, this course will provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to effectively implement the Near Man Defense in game situations. We look forward to teaching you this valuable defense strategy and helping you take your lacrosse skills to the next level.

This Master Class includes the Near Man Defense Playbook PDF.

column2: Virginia's 2-2-2 From X Team Master Classes Membership
column3:
Virginia’s 2-2-2 from X played an extensive role in their 2019 National Championship run. Virginia used it to score: the game-winning goal in overtime vs Syracuse in the regular season, the game-winning goal in overtime vs Maryland in the quarterfinals, the game-tying and game-winning goals vs Duke in the Semi-Finals, and 5 of 13 goals in the National Championship vs Yale.

The keys to Virginia’s 2-2-2 from X are:

Simplicity - It’s simple enough to allow players to alternate between positions.

Easy Reads - Defensive decisions create a cascade of reads that are easy to see and teach.

Spacing - The spacing makes defensive decisions difficult and allows players to freelance easily if the prescribed looks aren’t there.

This Master Class includes the Virginia 2-2-2 From X POWLAX Playbook PDF.

Upon completing the quiz with an 80% score, you will receive a POWLAX Certificate of Completion.

This is a Team Master Class.  You will receive 30 sub-accounts for your staff and players!  Follow the instructions in the confirmation email to add your staff and players.  If this number is insufficient, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com

column2: 21-12 Motion Offense Team Master Class Membership
column3: Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 21-12 offensive concept! This innovative course will teach you a revolutionary approach to offense that combines four traditional sets – 2-2-2, 2-3-1, 1-3-2, and Open – into a single, easy-to-understand system. The 21-12 concept is perfect for coaches looking to quickly train and modify their players' skills using small-sided 3 Man games and motions. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide you with the knowledge and tools you need to take your team's offensive game to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now! Complete this Master Class and receive the “21-12 Motion Offense” Completion Certificate. column2: Executing and Defending 2 Man Games Team Master Class Membership
column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 2 Man Game! This comprehensive course will teach you about the various tactics and strategies used by two players with the goal of getting one of them open and in on goal. The 2 Man Game has become a staple of collegiate lacrosse, with every team that made the NCAA Tournament in 2019 using it as a primary attacking principle within their offense. In this course, you will learn about the perfect Pick and a range of other options that players have as they move into and out of the traditional "Pick and Roll" scenario. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through the key principles and tactics of the 2 Man Game, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the "Executing and Defending 2 Man Games Playbook PDF."

This Master Class includes many lessons with their own individual quizzes.

column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Ohio State Pairs Offense! This course will take you through the offensive system that Ohio State used to crush Denver in 2017 on their way to a National Championship appearance. The pairs offense has gained popularity with the widespread adoption of 2 Man Game principles and is known for being extremely simple and requiring players to be diligent and make great decisions. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to successfully implement the Ohio State Pairs Offense in your team's game plan. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Ohio State Pairs POWLAX Playbook PDF.

column2: Penn State Offense Team Master Class Membership
column3: Led by, 2019 Tewaaraton Award Finalist and record setting distributor Grant Ament (1) and sniper Mac O’Keefe (3), Penn State scored 17.94 goals per game and had the #1 offense in 2019. Although the performance of Ament and O’Keefe drew the headlines, neither would have achieved nearly as much without the exceptional play of: Dylan Foulds (14), Nick Spillane (13), Jack Kelly (25), TJ Malone (7), and a few others. Anytime the defense gave Ament or O’Keefe too much room they would get burned. When the defense adjusted to help cover Ament or O’Keefe the others would capitalize. The six players were like piranhas, combining to be nearly unstoppable. This Master Class will walk you through the 3 phases of the Penn State Offense: The 3 High Pairs Offense, 1-4-1 Wing Pairs Offense, and the Picks Behind Offense. This Master Class includes the Penn State Offense Playbook PDF This is a Team Master Class.  You will receive 30 sub-accounts for your staff and players!  Follow the instructions in the confirmation email to add your staff and players.  If this number is insufficient, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on Wesleyan's 2018 National Championship 3-3 Zone Defense! In this course, you will learn the ins and outs of this successful defensive strategy step by step. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every aspect of the 3-3 Zone Defense, from its key principles to its tactical implementation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to effectively run Wesleyan's 2018 National Championship defense. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's defense to the next level – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Wesleyan Championship 3-3 Zone Playbook PDF and Quiz. Complete the quiz with a score of 80% and receive the POWLAX Wesleyan Championship 3-3 Zone Certificate.

column2: Penn State's 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense Team Master Class Membership
column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense! This course will teach you the first portion of Penn State's 2019 offense, which utilizes pairs on the wings, an off-ball player up top, and hang-up games at X. Patrick will guide you through the key principles and tactics of the 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team's offense to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Penn State 1-4-1 Wing Picks Offense Playbook PDF. Complete the 1-4-1- Wing Pairs Offense quiz with a score of 80% or more and receive the POWLAX 1-4-1 Wing Pairs Offense Certificate of Completion! This is a Team Master Class.  You will receive 30 sub-accounts for your staff and players!  Follow the instructions in the confirmation email to add your staff and players.  If this number is insufficient, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com

column2: Face Off Plays Team Master Class Membership
column3: Welcome to our lacrosse master class on mastering faceoffs! Faceoffs can be a crucial factor in winning or losing a game, so it's important to have a solid strategy in place. In this course, we will teach you a simple but effective approach to faceoffs that will give your faceoff unit the best chance of success at the X. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse player or coach, this course will provide you with the strategy you need to dominate the faceoff X. Sign up now to learn how to win the important battles at the X and give your team a competitive edge. This Master Class includes the Face-Off Plays Playbook PDF. This is a Team Master Class.  You will receive 30 sub-accounts for your staff and players!  Follow the instructions in the confirmation email to add your staff and players.  If this number is insufficient, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com

column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on off-ball decision-making in 2 Man Games! In this course, you will learn about the choices and options available to off-ball players in various 2 Man Games situations. Patrick will guide you through the key principles and tactics of off-ball decision-making, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach or player, this course will help you take your team's offensive decision-making within 2 Man Games to the next level. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the “Executing and Defending 2 Man Games” PDF!

This is a Team Master Class.  You will receive 30 sub-accounts for your staff and players!  Follow the instructions in the confirmation email to add your staff and players.  If this number is insufficient, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com
column36: 2 Man Game - Off Ball Options - Team Master Class Membership

Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}

Please make sure to read through this email completely to get the most out of your experience with POWLAX.

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

Username: {$username}

Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing Your POWLAX Master Classes

Access {$product_name} by clicking this link while logged in to POWLAX.com.  To get there manually, login to POWLAX.com > click the menu > Account > My Master Classes.

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account

You can add your players/coaches by clicking the Sub Accounts Button in the right column on this page: https://powlax.com/account/?action=subscriptions

Please make sure you are logged in when you click the link or it will not work.

To navigate there manually go to

Account > My account > Subscriptions > Click the Sub Accounts button on the right side of the screen.  You will then be able to add your Sub Accounts.

If you do not have the Sub Accounts option on the subscriptions page, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF's

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to the Master Class POWLAX Playbook PDFs.  To download the PDFs, log in to POWLAX.com > Click the Menu > Click Account > Click My Master Classes > Navigate to the Master Class of the Playbook PDF that you want > The PDF will be in the Materials Section on the Lesson Page of the Master Class.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

column2: Platinum Single Team Membership
column36: Platinum Team Membership
column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:40:"** Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}";s:4:"body";s:6420:"

Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}

Please make sure to read through this email completely to get the most out of your experience with POWLAX.

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

Username: {$username}

Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s.  To download the PDF’s, log in to POWLAX.com and use the menu to navigate to a strategy or drill video click the red pdf button under the video to download the Playbook PDF that corresponds to the video.

Activating The POWLAX Digital Playbook on Lacrosse Lab. 

As a part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com.  I will be adding you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually.  Please allow up to 24 hours to receive the invite email.  Make sure to check your junk folder.  If you do not receive the email from lacrosse lab, please email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Lacrosse lab is best when using their iOS App.  Download it from the Apple App Store.

Utilizing Lacrosse Labs Practice Planning and Event Notifications

If you are planning to utilize the email notifications from lacrosse lab service, make sure to find the lacrosse lab email invite to join.  That way your email server will put their emails into your inbox and not your junk folder.

Sharing the POWLAX Digital Playbook Plays with Your Team

As a part of {$product_name} you have the ability to share the plays and drills from the POWLAX Digital Playbook with your players.  In order to do that, you must have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account.  If you do not have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account, you can get more information here: https://labradorsports.com/lacrosse-pricing/

Once you have a team account and access to the POWLAX Gold Account, you will be able to share the plays from the POWLAX Gold Account to your team account by clicking on the plays or folders in the POWLAX Gold Playbook, clicking share, and sharing them to your team.

Activating your Team Branded Master Class

As a part of {$product_name}, I will be building you Team Branded Set of 5 Master Classes for your team.

Please email patrick@powlax.com with the combination of 5 Master Classes that you would like to use for your team.

You can view the available Master Classes on the bottom of this page > https://powlax.com/powlax-master-classes-landing-page/

The Team branded Master Class takes 3-5 days to be built. When it has been completed, you will receive an email letting you know,  You’ll be able to access it by clicking on the menu and going to: Account > My Master Classes.

NOTE: {$product_name} does not give you access to the Master Classes automatically.  The Team Branded Master Classes must be built first.

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account

NOTE: You will not be adding player and coach accounts to {$product_name}.  You will add them to the Team Branded Master Class once it has been completed.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

";}}

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on running a 10 Man Ride! In this comprehensive Master Class, you will learn everything you need to cause turnovers running a 10 Man Ride. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every step, from how to play the field with your goalie and bump up to apply pressure and create traps. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills you need to successfully implement the 10 Man Ride in your team's game plan. Don't miss this opportunity to take your team's riding game to the next level – sign up now!

Complete the quiz with a score of 80% or more and receive the POWLAX Certificate of Completion.

Team Master Classes include 30 additional Sub Accounts for Players and Staff.

Master Classes Build Lacrosse IQ Fast

  • Bite-Sized Content
  • Save Time
  • Educate Yourself and Your Team
  • Mobile and Desktop
  • Earn Certificates

Information for Everyone

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s.  To download the PDF’s, log in to POWLAX.com and use the “Coaches Corner” in the footer menu to navigate to a strategy or drill video. Click the red pdf button under the video to download the Playbook PDF that corresponds to the video. PDF’s can also be found in the Materials Section of Master Class Lessons.

Accessing Your Master Classes

Access {$product_name} by clicking this link (My Master Classes while logged in to POWLAX.com. 

To get there manually, login to POWLAX.com > Go to My Stuff > My Master Classes in any header menu.

For Coaches

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account

To add your players/coaches to your Team Master Class or Online Skills Academy, Click Here “My Subscriptions", then click the “Blue Sub Accounts Button in the right column of your Team Master Class Row.   You can add them manually or allow them to register themselves by sending the link on the bottom of the page.

Please make sure you are logged in when you click the link or it will not work.

To navigate there manually go to

Menu > My Stuff > My Account > Subscriptions (Blue Below Your Profile).

*If you do not have the Sub Accounts option on the subscriptions page, please email me at Patrick@POWLAX.com.

I’m excited to welcome you to POWLAX and the {$product_name}.  Thank you for making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey!

- Patrick Chapla

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 2-3-2 Clear! In this comprehensive course, you will be taken step by step through the key principles and tactical implementation of this powerful clearing strategy. Our experienced instructors will provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to effectively run the 2-3-2 Clear, whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's clear to the next level – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the 2-3-2 Clear Playbook PDF and Master Class Quiz

Complete the 2-3-2 Master Class quiz with a score of 80% or better to receive the 2-3-2 Clear Master Class Certificate of Completion!

Master Classes Build Lacrosse IQ Fast

  • Bite-Sized Content
  • Save Time
  • Educate Yourself and Your Team
  • Mobile and Desktop
  • Earn Certificates

You can login here: {$login_page}

Using this username and password:

Username: {$username}

Password: The password you set up during registration.

Accessing the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to all of the POWLAX Playbook PDF’s.  To download the PDF’s, log in to POWLAX.com and use the menu to navigate to a strategy or drill video click the red pdf button under the video to download the Playbook PDF that corresponds to the video.

Activating The POWLAX Digital Playbook on Lacrosse Lab. 

As a part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com.  I will be adding you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually.  Please allow up to 24 hours to receive the invite email.  Make sure to check your junk folder.  If you do not receive the email from lacrosse lab, please email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Lacrosse lab is best when using their iOS App.  Download it from the Apple App Store.

Utilizing Lacrosse Labs Practice Planning and Event Notifications

If you are planning to utilize the email notifications from lacrosse lab service, make sure to find the lacrosse lab email invite to join.  That way your email server will put their emails into your inbox and not your junk folder.

Sharing the POWLAX Digital Playbook Plays with Your Team

As a part of {$product_name} you have the ability to share the plays and drills from the POWLAX Digital Playbook with your players.  In order to do that, you must have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account.  If you do not have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account, you can get more information here: https://labradorsports.com/lacrosse-pricing/

Once you have a team account and access to the POWLAX Gold Account, you will be able to share the plays from the POWLAX Gold Account to your team account by clicking on the plays or folders in the POWLAX Gold Playbook, clicking share, and sharing them to your team.

Activating your Team Branded Master Class

As a part of {$product_name}, I will be building you Team Branded Set of 5 Master Classes for your team.

Please email patrick@powlax.com with the combination of 5 Master Classes that you would like to use for your team.

You can view the available Master Classes on the bottom of this page > https://powlax.com/powlax-master-classes-landing-page/

The Team branded Master Class takes 3-5 days to be built. When it has been completed, you will receive an email letting you know,  You’ll be able to access it by clicking on the menu and going to: Account > My Master Classes.

NOTE: {$product_name} does not give you access to the Master Classes automatically.  The Team Branded Master Classes must be built first.

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account

NOTE: You will not be adding player and coach accounts to {$product_name}.  You will add them to the Team Branded Master Class once it has been completed.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

column2: POWLAX Youth Lacrosse Coaching Master Class Membership
column3:
• Master Class Story
  • Our Mission
  • Master Class Outline
  • Testimonials
  • Register
Start My Free Trial
Terms: 3 Days for free then $249 / Year Have a coupon? Invalid Coupon Coupon applied successfully Pay with your credit card via Stripe Pay via your PayPal account We Respect Your Privacy Please fix the errors above
[mepr-membership-registration-form id="14815"]

Elevate Your Coaching Skills with the POWLAX Youth Lacrosse Coaching Master Class

Become a highly skilled and strategic coach, adept in both the fundamentals and advanced tactics of lacrosse. Effectively train and inspire a team of young athletes, fostering a deep love for the game and a strong sense of teamwork. The team will flourish under your guidance, enjoying both the thrill of competition and the camaraderie of playing a sport they love while achieving significant improvements in their skills and performance

Create the Ultimate Lacrosse Experience

We believe that playing lacrosse can help to develop the traits of successful people. By creating environments that enhance the players' love of the game, we help them to enjoy the process of becoming better people. For most, lacrosse is just a game. To us, it’s a method of cultivating the skills and mindset necessary to be successful in life. We Create Confident Coaches Because Confident Coaches Create Great Environments For Players.
  • Structured Learning Path
  • Effective Community Involvement
  • Adaptive Coaching Emphasis for Age and Skill Level
  • Expert Skill and Fundamental Development
  • Holistic View of How The Game Works and Strategies
  • Extensive Focus on Practice Planning and Execution

Master Class Outline

Lesson 1: Building an Understanding and Appreciation of Lacrosse Dive into the rich history and vibrant spirit of lacrosse in our first lesson. We’ll explore the cultural significance of the sport, its evolution, and modern representations. We’ll also discuss the significance of choosing the correct stick, the importance of the pocket, make comparisons to the big 5 sports, and cover basic rules and equipment. Lesson 2: Orienting Ourselves for Success This Season Lesson 2 focuses on meeting you where you are and exploring your situation to craft a holistic strategy for a triumphant season. We’ll navigate through the intricacies of goal setting while considering your unique coaching environment – understanding where you stand as a coach, your players’ diverse personalities and skill levels, and the dynamics of parent expectations and involvement. This lesson also delves into effectively leveraging support from administrators and collaborating with co-coaches. By doing so, you’ll learn to create a positive, achievement-oriented atmosphere, aligning your coaching tactics with your team’s multifaceted needs and aspirations. Lesson 3: Age and Skill Appropriate Coaching Lesson 3 is tailored to embrace the diversity of skill levels within your team, applying innovative coaching methodologies like the constraints-led approach and non-linear pedagogy. These modern techniques focus on adapting to the individual learning styles and developmental stages of each player. We’ll guide you through effectively coaching a range of abilities, ensuring that every player, regardless of their current skill level, is engaged, challenged, and growing. Lesson 4: Conducting Effective Lacrosse Practices Lesson 4 delves into the essentials of running a successful lacrosse practice. From the necessary equipment to the intricacies of the practice plan, we cover every aspect to ensure you’re fully equipped. Learn about the distinct roles and responsibilities of the coaching team, ensuring everyone plays their part effectively. We’ll also explore the elements that make a practice session great, including how to incorporate special positions like goalies and face-off specialists. This lesson is designed to empower you with the knowledge and skills to create engaging, productive, and skill-enhancing practices for your team. Lesson 5: Fundamental Techniques and Drills To Do at Home Lesson 5 is the cornerstone of coaching success. Coaches are equipped not only to teach but also to master key lacrosse skills themselves. We provide detailed techniques and drills for essential skills that coaches can practice at home, ensuring they can demonstrate and instruct with confidence. These skills include holding the stick, picking up ground balls, cradling, passing, catching, faking, and various shooting techniques like shooting on the run, in tight spaces, and with time and room. Additionally, this lesson covers individual defensive basics, providing a comprehensive toolkit for coaches to enhance their expertise and effectively pass on these skills to their players. Lesson 6: How The Game Works and Coaching Strategies In Lesson 6, we delve into the dynamic phases and flow of lacrosse, providing a detailed analysis of the strategies pertinent to each phase of the game. Coaches will learn not only the general tactics but also the specific strategies we at POWLAX recommend. We will introduce the POWLAX Coaching Pyramid, outlining the types of drills that are used to create team strategy. Additionally, this lesson includes an overview of the drills designed to build and reinforce each recommended strategy, ensuring coaches have a clear and effective roadmap for training their teams. Lesson 7: Practice Plans that Introducing The Game Lesson 7 is an exploration of two practice plans.  The first practice plan is built to introduce a new set of players to the game or allow you to evaluate a new group of players.  The second practice plan is the perfect practice to run with a team of players who are 8 years old and younger. We’ll guide you through each practice step by step, explain the function of each drill, and watch live video of the drills being run. Lesson 8: Practice Plans that Build Team Transition Lesson 8 introduces two distinct practice plans that focus on building the elements of transition play including clears, rides, face-off strategy, and transition offense and defense.  Patrick overviews the practices showing live video examples of each drill and explaining how each drill is used to build transition offensive and defensive principles.   Both plans come with the flexibility to be customized, ensuring they can be adapted to suit the unique needs of any team. Lesson 9: Practice Plans that Build Settled Offense and Defense Lesson 9 introduces two practice plans, one built for a team with a single coach and the other for at least 2 coaches, that focus on building the elements of settled offense and defense. Patrick overviews the practices showing live video examples of each drill and explaining how each drill is used to build transition offensive and defensive principles. As with all POWLAX plans, these are designed for easy modification, allowing coaches to tailor them to their team’s specific situation and goals. Lesson 10: Pre-game Practice Plan Lesson 10 walks through a practice plan that will prepare your team for game day. Focusing on complete strategies, we cover getting prepared to compete, tactical rehearsals, and scouting possibilities. Get your players game-ready with this practice plan. Lesson 11: Game Day Lesson 11 equips coaches with strategies to manage the excitement and challenges of game days. This session delves into pre-game preparations, including team briefings, warm-up routines, and last-minute tactical adjustments. Coaches learn how to maintain team focus, handle in-game scenarios effectively, and ensure a positive experience for players, regardless of the game’s outcome. "I use a lot of your content and videos, especially when it comes to your schemes. Such as your 3-3 Zone break down (Wesleyans Championship Zone) and your pairs offense (Ohio State Pairs). Often times we can just send that film to our guys so they can watch it before practice or a meeting we have." Bill CosentinoHead Coach St. Josephs College "If you're teaching beginners at the youth level or preparing elite players to compete at the national level, POWALX provides the structure and content to help you effectively teach. Coaches and players can all benefit from the content provided by POWLAX." Dan DowdStafford Lacrosse Association / Fredericksburg Lacrosse Club / Colonial Forge High School "We have new parents joining our organization all the time, but they’re not necessarily lacrosse coaches.  The question we have to answer is how do we teach them to coach?  POWLAX’s content covers the gamut of techniques and strategies, so new coaches can learn the basics and experienced coaches can get really in-depth.  His content is awesome, and there is nothing out there like it for coaches!" Bryan InagakiDirector - Avon Grove Youth Lacrosse Great content, and it is presented in a way that we as coaches can use on the entire range of youth and HS players. I'm sure it is as valuable at the higher levels, but I don't have experience there. Very balanced, and has the priorities right. Brian HiltonFather Coach The material is well thought out, communicated and edited. Its helped me be a better coach so I can give my players the best possible lacrosse experience. Richie HogleFormer Cal Coach I most appreciate how well you "curate" information - picking out the most important topics and how you present with both video and PDFs. Very clear and well edited! David PocockPrimeTime Lacrosse - Head Lacrosse Coach Concord at Academy

Access Risk Free For 3 Days!

Join Patrick Chapla in this comprehensive Master Class, designed for coaches at all levels. This program is a complete system to understand and teach youth lacrosse effectively. Whether you're a seasoned coach or a parent stepping into the role, this Master Class offers a one-stop solution for all your coaching needs by providing you with the mental scaffolding to integrate all of your lacrosse coaching knowledge.
Start My Free Trial

Newcomer and 8U Lacrosse Coaching Fast Track

Learn to create incredible lacrosse environments without digging through all the random videos on the internet, traveling to a training events, or getting lost in advanced topics for  older age groups. This master class is specifically designed to quickly bring coaches of young players up to speed, focusing on the fundamental skills and basic strategies of the game. We aim to train coaches who are new to lacrosse in a way that instills a deep appreciation for the sport, emphasizing both individual skill development and the importance of understanding the developmental capacity of your players. The program is structured to ensure that participants enjoy their introduction to the sport, experiencing the excitement of learning and playing while making noticeable progress in their abilities. Through this training, coaches will create incredible environments, setting their players up for future success both in competitive play and in enjoying the sport recreationally. Click here if you're coaching a middle or high school level team.

Create the Ultimate Lacrosse Experience

We believe that playing lacrosse can help to develop the traits of successful people. By creating environments that enhance the players' love of the game, we help them to enjoy the process of becoming better people. For most, lacrosse is just a game. To us, it’s a method of cultivating the skills and mindset necessary to be successful in life. We Create Confident Coaches Because Confident Coaches Create Great Environments For Players.
  • Structured Learning Path
  • Effective Community Involvement
  • Adaptive Coaching Emphasis for Age and Skill Level
  • Expert Skill and Fundamental Development
  • Holistic View of How The Game Works and Strategies
  • Extensive Focus on Practice Planning and Execution

Newcomer and 8U Master Class Outline

Lesson 1: Building an Understanding and Appreciation of Lacrosse Dive into the rich history and vibrant spirit of lacrosse in our first lesson. We’ll explore the cultural significance of the sport, its evolution, and modern representations. We’ll also discuss the significance of choosing the correct stick, the importance of the pocket, make comparisons to the big 5 sports, and cover basic rules and equipment. Lesson 2: Orienting Ourselves for Success This Season Lesson 2 focuses on meeting you where you are and exploring your situation to craft a holistic strategy for a triumphant season. We’ll navigate through the intricacies of goal setting while considering your unique coaching environment – understanding where you stand as a coach, your players’ diverse personalities and skill levels, and the dynamics of parent expectations and involvement. This lesson also delves into effectively leveraging support from administrators and collaborating with co-coaches. By doing so, you’ll learn to create a positive, achievement-oriented atmosphere, aligning your coaching tactics with your team’s multifaceted needs and aspirations. Lesson 3: Age and Skill Appropriate Coaching Lesson 3 is tailored to embrace the diversity of skill levels within your team, applying innovative coaching methodologies like the constraints-led approach and non-linear pedagogy. These modern techniques focus on adapting to the individual learning styles and developmental stages of each player. We’ll guide you through effectively coaching a range of abilities, ensuring that every player, regardless of their current skill level, is engaged, challenged, and growing. Lesson 4: Conducting Effective Lacrosse Practices Lesson 4 delves into the essentials of running a successful lacrosse practice. From the necessary equipment to the intricacies of the practice plan, we cover every aspect to ensure you’re fully equipped. Learn about the distinct roles and responsibilities of the coaching team, ensuring everyone plays their part effectively. We’ll also explore the elements that make a practice session great, including how to incorporate special positions like goalies and face-off specialists. This lesson is designed to empower you with the knowledge and skills to create engaging, productive, and skill-enhancing practices for your team. Lesson 5: Fundamental Techniques and Drills To Do at Home Lesson 5 is the cornerstone of coaching success. Coaches are equipped not only to teach but also to master key lacrosse skills themselves. We provide detailed techniques and drills for essential skills that coaches can practice at home, ensuring they can demonstrate and instruct with confidence. These skills include holding the stick, picking up ground balls, cradling, passing, catching, faking, and various shooting techniques like shooting on the run, in tight spaces, and with time and room. Additionally, this lesson covers individual defensive basics, providing a comprehensive toolkit for coaches to enhance their expertise and effectively pass on these skills to their players. Lesson 6: How The Game Works and Coaching Strategies In Lesson 6, we delve into the dynamic phases and flow of lacrosse, providing a detailed analysis of the strategies pertinent to each phase of the game and what you can expect your young team to do. This lesson includes an overview of the drills designed to build and reinforce each recommended strategy, ensuring coaches have a clear and effective roadmap for training their teams. Lesson 7: 8U Practice Plans and Introducing The Game Lesson 7 is an exploration of two practice plans.  The first practice plan is built to introduce a new set of players to the game or allow you to evaluate a new group of players.  The second practice plan is the perfect practice to run with a team of players who are 8 years old and younger. We’ll guide you through each practice step by step, explain the function of each drill, and watch live video of the drills being run. Lesson 8: Game Day Lesson 11 equips coaches with strategies to manage the excitement and challenges of game days. This session delves into pre-game preparations, including team briefings, warm-up routines, and last-minute tactical adjustments. Coaches learn how to maintain team focus, handle in-game scenarios effectively, and ensure a positive experience for players, regardless of the game’s outcome. "I use a lot of your content and videos, especially when it comes to your schemes. Such as your 3-3 Zone break down (Wesleyans Championship Zone) and your pairs offense (Ohio State Pairs). Often times we can just send that film to our guys so they can watch it before practice or a meeting we have." Bill CosentinoHead Coach St. Josephs College "If you're teaching beginners at the youth level or preparing elite players to compete at the national level, POWALX provides the structure and content to help you effectively teach. Coaches and players can all benefit from the content provided by POWLAX." Dan DowdStafford Lacrosse Association / Fredericksburg Lacrosse Club / Colonial Forge High School "We have new parents joining our organization all the time, but they’re not necessarily lacrosse coaches.  The question we have to answer is how do we teach them to coach?  POWLAX’s content covers the gamut of techniques and strategies, so new coaches can learn the basics and experienced coaches can get really in-depth.  His content is awesome, and there is nothing out there like it for coaches!" Bryan InagakiDirector - Avon Grove Youth Lacrosse Great content, and it is presented in a way that we as coaches can use on the entire range of youth and HS players. I'm sure it is as valuable at the higher levels, but I don't have experience there. Very balanced, and has the priorities right. Brian HiltonFather Coach The material is well thought out, communicated and edited. Its helped me be a better coach so I can give my players the best possible lacrosse experience. Richie HogleFormer Cal Coach I most appreciate how well you "curate" information - picking out the most important topics and how you present with both video and PDFs. Very clear and well edited! David PocockPrimeTime Lacrosse - Head Lacrosse Coach Concord at Academy

Access Free For 3 Days!

Join Patrick Chapla in this comprehensive Master Class, designed for coaches of 8U and Newcomer teams up to 10 years old. This program is a complete system to understand and teach your team effectively. Whether you're a seasoned coach or a parent stepping into the role, this Master Class offers a one-stop solution for all your coaching needs by providing you with exactly the information you need to have an amazing season! Coaching middle school or high school level team?  Check out the POWLAX Youth Lacrosse Coaching Master Class.

column104: settings"":{""title"":""Newcomer and 8U Lacrosse Coaching Fast Track""
column111:
settings"":{""editor"":""

Learn to create incredible lacrosse environments without digging through all the random videos on the internet
column113:
or getting lost in advanced topics for  older age groups.<\/p>\n

This master class is specifically designed to quickly bring coaches of young players up to speed
column114: focusing on the fundamental skills and basic strategies of the game. We aim to train coaches who are new to lacrosse in a way that instills a deep appreciation for the sport
column115:
emphasizing both individual skill development and the importance of understanding the developmental capacity of your players.<\/p>\n

The program is structured to ensure that participants enjoy their introduction to the sport
column116: experiencing the excitement of learning and playing while making noticeable progress in their abilities. Through this training
column118:
setting their players up for future success both in competitive play and in enjoying the sport recreationally.<\/p>\n

Click here if you're coaching a middle or high school level team.<\/b><\/a><\/p>""
column180:
settings"":{""editor"":""

We believe that playing lacrosse can help to develop the traits of successful people.\u00a0<\/p>

By creating environments that enhance the players' love of the game
column181:
we help them to enjoy the process of becoming better people.<\/p>

For most
column182: lacrosse is just a game. To us
column183:
it\u2019s a method of cultivating the skills and mindset necessary to be successful in life.<\/p>

We Create Confident Coaches Because Confident Coaches Create Great Environments For Players.<\/strong><\/p>""
column228: text"":""Adaptive Coaching Emphasis for Age and Skill Level""
column235: {""text"":""Holistic View of How The Game Works and Strategies ""
column240: text"":""Extensive Focus on Practice Planning and Execution""
column313: settings"":{""tabs"":[{""tab_title"":""Lesson 1: Building an Understanding and Appreciation of Lacrosse""
column314:
tab_content"":""

Dive into the rich history and vibrant spirit of lacrosse in our first lesson. We\u2019ll explore the cultural significance of the sport
column316: and modern representations. We'll also discuss the significance of choosing the correct stick
column318: make comparisons to the big 5 sports
column319: and cover basic rules and equipment.<\/p>""
column321: {""tab_title"":""Lesson 2: Orienting Ourselves for Success This Season""
column322:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 2 focuses on meeting you where you are and exploring your situation to craft a holistic strategy for a triumphant season. We'll navigate through the intricacies of goal setting while considering your unique coaching environment \u2013 understanding where you stand as a coach
column323: your players' diverse personalities and skill levels
column324: and the dynamics of parent expectations and involvement. This lesson also delves into effectively leveraging support from administrators and collaborating with co-coaches. By doing so
column325: you'll learn to create a positive
column327: aligning your coaching tactics with your team's multifaceted needs and aspirations.<\/p>""
column330: tab_title"":""Lesson 3: Age and Skill Appropriate Coaching""
column331:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 3 is tailored to embrace the diversity of skill levels within your team
column332: applying innovative coaching methodologies like the constraints-led approach and non-linear pedagogy. These modern techniques focus on adapting to the individual learning styles and developmental stages of each player. We'll guide you through effectively coaching a range of abilities
column334: regardless of their current skill level
column340:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 4 delves into the essentials of running a successful lacrosse practice. From the necessary equipment to the intricacies of the practice plan
column341: we cover every aspect to ensure you\u2019re fully equipped. Learn about the distinct roles and responsibilities of the coaching team
column342: ensuring everyone plays their part effectively. We'll also explore the elements that make a practice session great
column343: including how to incorporate special positions like goalies and face-off specialists. This lesson is designed to empower you with the knowledge and skills to create engaging
column345: and skill-enhancing practices for your team.<\/p>""}
column347: tab_title"":""Lesson 5: Fundamental Techniques and Drills To Do at Home""
column348:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 5 is the cornerstone of coaching success. Coaches are equipped not only to teach but also to master key lacrosse skills themselves. We provide detailed techniques and drills for essential skills that coaches can practice at home
column349: ensuring they can demonstrate and instruct with confidence. These skills include holding the stick
column355: and various shooting techniques like shooting on the run
column357: and with time and room. Additionally
column358: this lesson covers individual defensive basics
column359: providing a comprehensive toolkit for coaches to enhance their expertise and effectively pass on these skills to their players.<\/p>""}
column361: tab_title"":""Lesson 6: How The Game Works and Coaching Strategies""
column363: we delve into the dynamic phases and flow of lacrosse
column364: providing a detailed analysis of the strategies pertinent to each phase of the game and what you can expect your young team to do. This lesson includes an overview of the drills designed to build and reinforce each recommended strategy
column365: ensuring coaches have a clear and effective roadmap for training their teams.<\/p>""}
column367: tab_title"":""Lesson 7: 8U Practice Plans and Introducing The Game""
column368:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 7 is an exploration of two practice plans.\u00a0 The first practice plan is built to introduce a new set of players to the game or allow you to evaluate a new group of players.\u00a0 The second practice plan is the perfect practice to run with a team of players who are 8 years old and younger. We\u2019ll guide you through each practice step by step
column369: explain the function of each drill
column370: and watch live video of the drills being run.<\/p>""}
column373:
tab_content"":""

Lesson 11 equips coaches with strategies to manage the excitement and challenges of game days. This session delves into pre-game preparations
column376: and last-minute tactical adjustments. Coaches learn how to maintain team focus
column378: and ensure a positive experience for players
column425: content"":""\"I use a lot of your content and videos
column426: especially when it comes to your schemes. Such as your 3-3 Zone break down (Wesleyans Championship Zone) and your pairs offense (Ohio State Pairs). Often times we can just send that film to our guys so they can watch it before practice or a meeting we have.\"""
column434: {""content"":""\"If you're teaching beginners at the youth level or preparing elite players to compete at the national level
column435: POWALX provides the structure and content to help you effectively teach.  Coaches and players can all benefit from the content provided by POWLAX.\"""
column437: title"":""Stafford Lacrosse Association \/ Fredericksburg Lacrosse Club \/ Colonial Forge High School""
column445: content"":""\"We have new parents joining our organization all the time
column446: but they\u2019re not necessarily lacrosse coaches.\u00a0\u00a0The question we have to answer is how do we teach them to coach?\u00a0\u00a0POWLAX\u2019s content covers the gamut of techniques and strategies
column447: so new coaches can learn the basics and experienced coaches can get really in-depth.\u00a0\u00a0His content is awesome
column448: and there is nothing out there like it for coaches!\"""
column457: and it is presented in a way that we as coaches can use on the entire range of youth and HS players. I'm sure it is as valuable at the higher levels
column458: but I don't have experience there. Very balanced
column469: communicated and edited. Its helped me be a better coach so I can give my players the best possible lacrosse experience.""
column478: {""content"":""I most appreciate how well you \"curate\" information - picking out the most important topics and how you present with both video and PDFs. Very clear and well edited! ""
column480: title"":""PrimeTime Lacrosse - Head Lacrosse Coach Concord at Academy""

settings"":{""editor"":""

Join Patrick Chapla in this comprehensive Master Class
column552: designed for coaches of 8U and Newcomer teams up to 10 years old<span style=\"font-size: 23px;\">. This program is a complete system to understand and teach your team effectively. Whether you're a seasoned coach or a parent stepping into the role
column553:
this Master Class offers<\/span>\u00a0a one-stop solution for all your coaching needs by\u00a0<\/span>providing you with exactly the information you need to have an amazing season!<\/span><\/p>

Coaching middle school or high school level team?\u00a0 Check out the POWLAX Youth Lacrosse Coaching Master Class.<\/span><\/a><\/p>""

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the Cuse Motion Offense! In this comprehensive course, you will be taken step by step through the key principles and tactics of this popular offensive system. Our experienced instructor, Patrick, will guide you through every aspect of the Cuse Motion Offense, providing you with the knowledge and skills you need to implement it effectively. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will help you take your team’s offense to the next level. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn from the best – sign up now!

This Master Class includes the Cuse Motion Offense POWLAX Playbook PDF.

Earn the Cuse Motion Offense Certificate of Completion by passing the quiz with a score of 80% or highe.

Master Classes Build Lacrosse IQ Fast

  • Bite-Sized Content
  • Save Time
  • Educate Yourself and Your Team
  • Mobile and Desktop
  • Earn Certificates

Our experienced instructors will guide you through every step, from how to read the defense and capitalize on what they give you. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills to successfully implement the 4 Man Wheel Man Up Offenses in your team's game plan. column2: 4 Man Wheel Man Up Offenses Team Master Class Membership
column3:
Welcome to our lacrosse master class on running the 4 Man Wheel Man Up Offenses! In this comprehensive Master Class, you will learn everything you need to execute the 4 Man Wheel Man Up Offenses. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every step, from how to read the defense and capitalize on what they give you. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills to successfully implement the 4 Man Wheel Man Up Offenses in your team's game plan. Don't miss this opportunity to take your team's Man Up to the next level – sign up now!

Complete the quiz with a score of 80% or more and receive the POWLAX Certificate of Completion.

This is a Team Master Class.  Once you register, you will be given 30 Sub Accounts to allow your players and other coaches take the Master Class!

column2: 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play Team Master Class
column3: Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! The lacrosse strategy involves executing the 141 double Mumbo that everyone loves but adds a weave motion over the top, using coordinated picks and player movements to disorient the defense and create multiple scoring opportunities. This approach emphasizes teamwork, timing, and precise execution to exploit defensive weaknesses and generate advantageous situations for attackers. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every aspect of the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play, from its key principles to its tactical implementation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills you need to run the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's power play to the next level – sign up now!

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! The lacrosse strategy involves executing the 141 double Mumbo that everyone loves but adds a weave motion over the top, using coordinated picks and player movements to disorient the defense and create multiple scoring opportunities. This approach emphasizes teamwork, timing, and precise execution to exploit defensive weaknesses and generate advantageous situations for attackers. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every aspect of the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play, from its key principles to its tactical implementation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills you need to run the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's power play to the next level – sign up now!

column2: 1-4-1 Shifted Triangles Motion Offense Team Master Class Membership
column3: Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Shifted Triangles Motion Offense! This lacrosse strategy involves a dynamic 141 offense derived from the traditional 2112 motion offense, focusing on player movement, positioning, and coordinated dodging to create scoring opportunities. It emphasizes a push-pull motion for ball handlers, strategic positioning for off-ball players, and quick adaptation to defensive actions to maintain offensive advantage and exploit weaknesses. Our experienced instructors will guide you through the ideas within the 1-4-1 Shifted Triangles Motion Offense, from its key principles to its tactical implementation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach, this course will provide the knowledge and skills you need to run the 1-4-1 Shifted Triangles Motion Offense! Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's power play to the next level – sign up now!

settings"":{""editor"":""

<\/p>

<\/p>

Welcome to our lacrosse master class on the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! The lacrosse strategy involves executing the 141 double Mumbo that everyone loves but adds a weave motion over the top
column94: using coordinated picks and player movements to disorient the defense and create multiple scoring opportunities. This approach emphasizes teamwork
column96: and precise execution to exploit defensive weaknesses and generate advantageous situations for attackers. Our experienced instructors will guide you through every aspect of the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play
column97: from its key principles to its tactical implementation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced lacrosse coach
column98:
this course will provide the knowledge and skills you need to run the 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play! Don't miss this opportunity to learn from the best and take your team's power play to the next level \u2013 sign up now!<\/p>

<\/p>

<\/p>""}

Adding your Players and Coaches to Your Account (https://youtu.be/6wLgD0izzwY)

You can add your players/coaches by clicking the Sub Accounts Button in the right column on this page: https://powlax.com/account/?action=subscriptions

Please make sure you are logged in when you click the link or it will not work.

To navigate there manually go to

Accessing the POWLAX Master Classes (https://youtu.be/ELVNDAgxSPk)

As a part of {$product_name}, you now have access to the Master Class POWLAX Playbook PDFs.  To download the PDFs, log in to POWLAX.com > Click the Menu > Click Account > Click My Master Classes > Navigate to the Master Class of the Playbook PDF that you want > The PDF will be in the Materials Section on the Lesson Page of the Master Class.

Sharing the POWLAX Digital Playbook Plays with Your Team (https://youtu.be/kLgn7jjQAOw)

As a part of {$product_name} you have the ability to share the plays and drills from the POWLAX Digital Playbook with your players.  In order to do that, you must have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account.  If you do not have a Lacrosse Lab Team Account, you can get more information here: https://labradorsports.com/lacrosse-pricing/

Once you have a team account and access to the POWLAX Gold Account, you will be able to share the plays from the POWLAX Gold Account to your team account by clicking on the plays or folders in the POWLAX Gold Playbook, clicking share, and sharing them to your team.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let's continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love!

- Patrick Chapla

column2: POWLAX Online Skills Academy : Monthly
column3:
The POWLAX Online Skills Academy is an all-in-one training platform designed to help lacrosse players improve their skills, track their progress, and compete against peers. Whether you’re an individual player aiming to level up or part of a team looking to foster competition and growth, the portal offers structured drills, achievements, and leaderboards to keep you engaged.
  • Over 100 Position and Skill-Based Workouts: Access a comprehensive library of drills tailored to your position, designed to sharpen your specific skills and elevate your game.
  • Gamification: Climb the ranks and earn position based achievements tied to position based skill sets.
  • Compete on the Leaderboard: Compete with your peers and teammates with personalized leaderboards.
column36: Player Development Portal
column61:
a:1:{s:27:"MeprUserProductWelcomeEmail";a:4:{s:7:"enabled";b:1;s:12:"use_template";b:1;s:7:"subject";s:40:"** Thanks for Purchasing {$product_name}";s:4:"body";s:2469:"

Thank you for registering for {$product_name}! We're thrilled to have you here.

There are 3 important things you'll need to know as you get started!

Important Pages

  1. Your Profile - This is where you can track your progress as you complete workouts within the portal.
  2. Ranks - Level up as you complete drills and challenges. Your rank reflects your overall effort and dedication, showcasing the total work you've put in along your journey to becoming a stronger player.
  3. Badges - Earn badgesby completing workouts that build specific skills important to each position. Don't know which Achievement to unlock first?  Take the 6-Question Lax Skill Check to find out!  It's totally free!
  4. Drill Bank - The Drill Bank is a collection of drills used to build skills without Gamification.
  5. Navigating Positional Workouts - Once you are in the Workout Section of the Portal, navigating between positions can be tricky.  There are Positional Navigation Pages found in the first option of the back-end menu that helps you to move between sections.

Not sure what you should work on?

Take the 6-question Lax Skill Check - It's completely free and will create a personalized report of which workouts will best help you reach your lacrosse goals!

Log in Info

You can log in here: {$login_page}
Using this username and password:
Username: {$username}
Password: *** Password you set during signup ***

You can cancel your subscription anytime directly through your account settings. If you’re in a free trial, you’ll still have full access for the entire 7-day period.

Cheers!
The {$blog_name} Team

";}}

2. Activating the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab

As part of {$product_name}, you have access to the POWLAX Digital Playbook on LacrosseLab.com. I will add you to the POWLAX Digital Playbook manually within 24 hours. Once added, you will receive an invite email from LacrosseLab—please check your spam or junk folder if you don’t see it in your inbox.

If you still don’t receive the invite, email me at Patrick@powlax.com.

Tip: For the best experience, download the LacrosseLab iOS app from the Apple App Store.

3. Utilizing LacrosseLab’s Practice Planning and Event Notifications

LacrosseLab includes tools for practice planning and event notifications. Once you receive the invitation email from LacrosseLab:

  1. Open the email and follow the instructions to join.
  2. Add LacrosseLab to your email contacts so future notifications land in your inbox instead of your junk folder.

Thanks again for purchasing {$product_name} and making POWLAX a part of your lacrosse journey! Together, let’s continue to inspire and elevate the game we all love.
